p: When analyzing common characteristics of patients, young age often correlated with asymptomatic or mild manifestations of COVID-19. Among 78 patients from Wuhan, China, asymptomatic individuals were younger than symptomatic patients (median age 37 vs. 56 years) ( Yang et al., 2020). In Nanjing, China, of 24 initially asymptomatic subjects, 29% who never showed symptoms were significantly younger than the presymptomatic group ( Hu et al., 2020). These results are supported by the data from the cruise ship, Diamond Princess; of 96 asymptomatic persons, eleven later developed symptoms that made them presymptomatic. The probability of evolving to a presymptomatic stage increased with age ( Sakurai et al., 2020).
